[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: layout_max_depth] [Resource exhaustion] Can attackers combine layout_max_depth=128 with layout_max_size=512 to create exponentially expensive layouts (128^512 complexity)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: type_max_cost] [Gas bypass] Are type costs properly charged to gas, or can attackers craft expensive types that bypass gas metering by exploiting type_max_cost=0 default? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Fields: type_base_cost, type_byte_cost] [Gas bypass] With default values of 0 for both, can attackers create arbitrarily expensive type operations without paying gas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: type_max_cost] [Integer overflow] Can the cost calculation (base_cost + byte_cost * bytes) overflow u64 and wrap to small values, bypassing gas charges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: type_max_cost] [Consensus divergence] If validators use different type cost values, can transactions succeed on low-cost validators but fail on high-cost validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Fields: type_base_cost, type_byte_cost] [Gas manipulation] Can governance attacks manipulate these costs to make type operations free or astronomically expensive, breaking gas economics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: delayed_field_optimization_enabled] [Consensus divergence] Can enabling this optimization on some validators but not others cause different execution results due to timing or state access patterns? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: delayed_field_optimization_enabled] [State corruption] Does delayed field optimization maintain proper atomicity, or can failures during delayed writes leave state partially committed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: delayed_field_optimization_enabled] [Race condition] Can concurrent transactions with delayed field optimization enabled cause race conditions in field access ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: delayed_field_optimization_enabled] [Default value] Why is default false? Can enabling it introduce security vulnerabilities that make it unsafe for production? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: ty_builder] [Consensus divergence] If validators use different TypeBuilder limits, can transactions with types between the limits cause execution divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: ty_builder] [Resource exhaustion] Are TypeBuilder limits enforced consistently everywhere, or can attackers bypass them through specific type construction paths? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: ty_builder] [Default value] Can the default TypeBuilder::with_limits(128, 20) be manipulated through governance to weaker limits that enable DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: enable_function_caches] [Cache poisoning] Can attackers exploit function caches to persist malicious code or state that survives transaction boundaries? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: enable_function_caches] [Cache invalidation] Is cache properly invalidated when modules are upgraded, or can stale cached functions execute causing incorrect behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: enable_function_caches] [Race condition] Can concurrent cache accesses with enable_function_caches=true cause race conditions if cache is shared across threads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: enable_function_caches] [Default value] Default is true - can disabling caches for security cause dramatic performance degradation enabling DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/config.rs] [Field: enable_lazy_loading] [Race condition] Can concurrent transactions trigger simultaneous lazy loads of the same module causing race conditions? (Medium)
